function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Inadequate ventilation and cooling capacity during extreme events leading to body heat overload and heat-related illnesses.","Impact":"Dizziness, fatigue, fainting, heat strokes, emergency department visits, and deaths.","Mitigation":"Upgrade ventilation and cooling systems, establish heat preparedness plans, and set up cooling centers for vulnerable populations.","Technologies":"Advanced HVAC systems, heat-reflective materials, and green roofs.","People":"Building occupants, especially the elderly and vulnerable populations.","Owner":"Building owners, city authorities, and urban planners."},{"Description":"Over-reliance on indoor cooling systems leading to increased electricity consumption, energy demand, and greenhouse gas emissions during heat waves.","Impact":"Increased electricity consumption, energy demand, and greenhouse gas emissions.","Mitigation":"Promote sustainable cooling strategies, establish heat preparedness plans, and advocate for the design of green roofs and cool pavements.","Technologies":"Renewable energy systems, energy-efficient HVAC systems, and green infrastructure.","People":"Building occupants, city residents, and environmental advocates.","Owner":"Building owners, city authorities, and environmental organizations."},{"Description":"Sandstorms leading to degraded air quality, respiratory problems, heart stress, and eye infections.","Impact":"Respiratory problems, heart stress, eye infections, and degraded air quality.","Mitigation":"Implement air filtration systems, promote use of face masks, and establish health advisories during sandstorms.","Technologies":"Air purifiers, HEPA filters, and protective face masks.","People":"Residents in areas prone to sandstorms.","Owner":"Local health authorities, city governments, and public health organizations."}]}
